txt.en: <rgb=#FF0000>Gori has been defeated!</rgb>
Gori is catching his breath after the battle and motions you over to talk with him.
Talk to Gori by the plaque
Talk to Gori
Gori Stonesetter walks among the ruins.
Gori mounts the stairs of Khur Azan, the Dim-crossing.
Defend Gori
Gori has led you across the Kibil-nâla, to the bottom of the great stairs.
Defend Gori
Gori has mounted a shattered bridge and looks deep in thought.
Gori has paused to speak with you before the next set of stairs.
'Can say with some confidence that those there statues are... dwarves.'

'Fundin's Steps. My ancestor spent much time working on this staircase. She wrote that she worked under the great stoneworker, King Fundin II. Landslides left the already ancient paths to Atrad-zarakh too perilous to safely traverse. They carved the stairs from the very bedrock itself!\n\n'Hmmm, what is that? A plaque? Let us get a closer look.'
'Look at this! Thousands of years and the steps remain strong! Solid work!'
'Look at the detailing - edges still sharp. The arches still soar high above!'
'Come, let us continue.'

'Fundin's Steps. My ancestor spent much time working on this staircase. She wrote that she worked under the great stoneworker, King Fundin II. Landslides left the already ancient paths to Atrad-zarakh too perilous to safely traverse. They carved the stairs from the very bedrock itself!'
'Hmmm, what is that? A plaque? Let us get a closer look.'
'Let us climb.'
'Bah, we must rid this area of the enemy for good.'
'What a sight this must have been! I would wager three trolls could jump up and down on this bridge without even causing it to tremble.'
'These stairs were the king's last great work before his death the following year. He fell most bravely, whilst hunting dragons in the north.'
Talk to Gori
Follow and protect Gori as he investigates the ruins
Follow and protect Gori as he investigates the ruins
Talk to Gori
Talk to Gori
Gori waits for you by the side of the River Kibil-nâla.

'See those pillars there? An ancestor of mine built them ages past! She left detailed journals of her time here. Sadly, the pages of the journal are as crumbled as the ruins, but I hope to learn more here. The stone of this valley has stood for many thousands of years.'
'I do believe I could spend decades just marvelling at the details here. But come, let us return to Amdân before more of the enemy comes looking for their friends.'
Talk to Gori
Talk to Gori on the bridge
Defend Gori
Defend Aighrig
Gori is catching his breath after the battle and motions you over to talk with him.
Talk to Gori
Lúkhag has led you to Aighrig, who has come to Dûn Traikh alone.
Follow and protect Gori as he investigates the ruins
<rgb=#FF0000>Gori has been defeated!</rgb>
Gori continues his way through the ruins, too distracted to notice any imminent danger.
<rgb=#FF0000>Lúkhag has been defeated!</rgb>
Gori is ascending Fundin's Stairs, which are crawling with the enemy.
Gori Stonesetter needs protection so that he might see for himself the ruins of the ancient buildings and bridges his ancestors helped build.
Gori has paused to speak with you before the next set of stairs.

'What a sight this must have been! I would wager three trolls could have jumped up and down on this bridge without even causing it to tremble. What could have shattered it in this way? Dragons, perhaps? I shall have to read my ancestor's journals more closely to seek the answer.'

Gori strokes his beard and takes notes in a leather bound book, now and then lifting a finger and squinting one eye, apparently taking a measurement. After a good many minutes, he looks up at you, startled.

'Oh! You are still here? Well, I do believe I have done all that I can for now.

'Come, let us make our way back to Amdân while the way remains cleared of enemy.'
Follow Gori

'My ancestor was close with Fundin’s widow, Vigdis. She wrote that the queen’s beard turned white when news of the king’s death reached her. Perhaps it was from grief, perhaps it was from having to take over the duties of ruling until their son, Kalin VI the Young, came of age in 501.'
Follow and protect Gori as he investigates the ruins

'My ancestor was close with Fundin’s widow, Vigdis. She wrote that the queen’s beard turned white when news of the king’s death reached her. Perhaps it was from grief, perhaps it was from having to take over the duties of ruling until their son, Kalin VI the Young, came of age in 501.

'Built over two thousand years ago, and now here we are! We walk where they walked. We look out at the same gold-topped Mallorn forest.

'Come, let us continue.'
Gori continues his way through the ruins, too distracted to notice any imminent danger.

'Khur Azan - the Dim-crossing. Built over two thousand years ago, and now here we are! A testament to our mastery over the valley. Look at these arches, and the detailing. Our ancestors were comfortable enough and had time enough to build grandly. This is no simple bridge over the Kibil-nâla, but a grand testament to the power and abilities of the builders.'
Gori has brought you to the top of the stairs, but the way is not free from danger.
<rgb=#FF0000>Gori has been defeated!</rgb>
DNT - Talk to Gori
The conversation between Latharn and Aighrig has not ended peacefully.
Instance: Ruins of the Ancestors

'Bah, we must rid this area of the enemy for good. Who knows what else might be buried under this earth? I am itching to get to work on repairs!\n\n'Come! I see another structure! There should be a bridge up there, according to the journals.'
